0.title: Anupam Kher fails to get Uunchai ticket as shows run housefull, shares video
0.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video of himself trying to buy a ticket for his movie 'Uunchai'. In the video, the man at the ticket counter can be seen telling him that there is no ticket available as the shows of the film are running housefull. "For the first time, saw success in failure," he wrote.

1.title: Former AIIMS Delhi director Randeep Guleria takes voluntary retirement
1.article_body: Randeep Guleria, former director of All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi, has taken voluntary retirement. Reports said Guleria served the institute for over 30 years. His five-and-a-half-year tenure as the director of the institute ended on September 23. He applied for Voluntary Retirement Scheme. Guleria had joined AIIMS as an assistant professor in Department of Medicine in 1992.

2.title: Donald Trump's daughter Tiffany marries businessman Michael Boulos; pics surface
2.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump and his ex-wife Marla Maple's daughter Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos got married in Mar-a-Lago on Saturday. Trump escorted his 29-year-old daughter down the aisle before she exchanged vows with the 25-year-old businessman. Melania, Ivanka, Eric, Donald Trump Jr were also present at the wedding.

3.title: Don't want people to gamble: Amit on refusing sports app endorsement
3.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh recently refused to endorse a sports app as he didn't want to promote something "that falls into grey areas". He said that even though he has huge respect for the game, he doesn't want people to gamble. "I don't wish to promote such things knowing how bad it can get. I would personally feel responsible," he shared.

4.title: 2-yr-old girl falls into open water tank at building, dies in Pune
4.article_body: A two-year-old girl died after she fell into an open water tank at an under-construction building in Pune. Following this, police booked the builder and contractor over their alleged negligence. The girl's father, who works as a labourer at the under-construction building, claimed in a complaint that the accused hadn't taken proper measures like covering the tank with a lid.

5.title: Blasting work at Navi Mumbai airport causing cracks in homes: Villagers
5.article_body: Blasting activity taking place during the construction of the Navi Mumbai International Airport has caused cracks to develop in houses, residents of the Wahal village have claimed. The village is located near the boundary of the airport. Earlier this month, the village sarpanch even wrote a letter to the City and Industrial Development Corporation of Maharashtra Limited over the matter.

6.title: ₹10,000 fine for mishap due to pet dog, cat in Noida; owner to pay medical expenses
6.article_body: Noida Authority has announced a fine of ₹10,000 in case of any mishap that takes place due to a pet dog or a pet cat. Besides that, the authority has said that medical expenses of the injured person or animal will be borne by the owner of the pet. Sterilization and anti-rabies vaccination of pet dogs has been made mandatory.

7.title: Was disrespected for my skin colour, slept without food: Mithun
7.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty shared that he was "disrespected for a lot of years" because of his skin colour. He remembered that there were days when he'd sleep with an empty stomach. "I used to cry myself to sleep," the actor said. Mithun added he doesn't want a biopic on him because his story will discourage people from achieving their dreams.

8.title: How much prize money will T20 World Cup 2022 winners, runners-up get today?
8.article_body: The winners of the T20 World Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and England today will get a prize money of $1.6 million. Meanwhile, the runners-up will receive $800,000. Apart from the prize money for the final match, the two teams will also get bonus for their Super 12 victories. They will be getting $40,000 per Super 12 stage match victory.

9.title: Twitter Blue will probably 'come back by end of next week,' says Musk
9.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user asking when Twitter Blue will return, Elon Musk replied, "Probably end of next week." On Friday, Twitter paused its recently announced  $8 blue tick subscription amid an increase in fake accounts. Twitter introduced the "Official" label last Wednesday but a few hours later, Musk tweeted that he had "killed" it.

10.title: Election workers in Himachal Pradesh trek for 15 km in deep snow for 6 hours
10.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing polling agents trekking in deep snow in Himachal Pradesh after the Assembly elections concluded on Saturday. The video shows polling parties returning from Chasak Batori polling station, situated at an altitude of 12,000 ft, in Bharmour  Assembly Constituency in Chamba district. They walked around 15 km in snow for 6 hours.

11.title: Iranian man who inspired 2004 film 'The Terminal' dies at Paris airport
11.article_body: Merhan Karimi Nasseri, an Iranian man who lived at Paris' Charles de Gaulle Airport from 1988 until 2006 and inspired the 2004 Steven Spielberg directorial 'The Terminal', passed away at the airport after suffering a heart attack on Saturday. He died at the Terminal 2F of the airport, where he had been living again in recent weeks.

12.title: Unmanned, solar-powered US space plane returns to Earth after 908 days, pic surfaces
12.article_body: An unmanned US military space plane returned to Earth on Saturday after spending 908 days in orbit, surpassing its previous record of 780 days. The solar-powered X-37B shuttle has now spent a total of more than 10 years in space and flown more than 1.3 billion miles during six missions, Boeing said in a statement.

13.title: Democrats retain control of US Senate in mid-term elections
13.article_body: President Joe Biden's Democrats retained control of the US Senate on Saturday in the mid-term elections, US media reports claimed. Democratic US Senator Catherine Cortez Masto has won re-election in Nevada, bringing the total number of seats under Democrats' control to 50. The results have defied predictions of Republican control over both the houses of US Congress.

14.title: Two planes collide mid-air and crash at US air show, video surfaces
14.article_body: Two World War II-era planes collided at an airshow causing a huge fireball explosion to shoot up into the air. It happened at the Commemorative Air Force's Wings Over Dallas Show in Dallas, Texas. Video of the incident shows the two show planes colliding head on with onlookers screaming in background. It wasn't immediately clear how many people were aboard.

15.title: 3 of a family killed in accident on Delhi-Lucknow highway
15.article_body: Three members of a family were killed after their speeding car rammed into another vehicle on the Delhi-Lucknow National Highway on Saturday evening, police said. The driver of the car reportedly died on the spot while two people, including a woman, were rushed to a government hospital where they were declared brought dead. The accident occurred in UP's Amroha district.

16.title: 5 Afghan nationals found dead at a home in Turkey's capital
16.article_body: Five Afghan nationals with stab wounds were found dead in Turkey's capital Ankara, Khaama Press reported citing Turkish media on Saturday. Afghan officials in Turkey confirmed the death of five Afghans in a house in an area where Afghan and Syrian refugees live. Authorities reportedly started looking for them after receiving missing person complaints from their families.

17.title: Vice President Dhankhar discusses bilateral ties with Cambodian PM
17.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar met Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen in Phnom Penh on Saturday and discussed the enhancement of ties in de-mining, human resource and development projects. The leaders witnessed the exchange of four agreements between the two countries in streams of health, culture and wildlife. Dhankhar commended Sen for his country's successful chairmanship of the ASEAN Summit.

18.title: 21 killed as bus falls into canal in Egypt’s Nile Delta
18.article_body: At least 21 people were killed, including three children, after a bus fell into a canal in the Nile River Delta region of Egypt on Saturday. The accident occurred in Dakahlia province, around 100 km northeast of the capital of Cairo. A senior provincial police official said the bus driver seemed to have lost control of the steering wheel.

19.title: Things Cristiano has done this season are not acceptable: Rooney
19.article_body: Former Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney has criticised Cristiano Ronaldo and asked him to keep his "head down" and "be ready to play when the manager needs you". "If he does that, he will be an asset. If he doesn't, it will become an unwanted distraction," said Rooney. He added that "things" Cristiano has done this season are "not acceptable".

20.title: India's current golden chess generation will only get better: Anand
20.article_body: Indian chess grandmaster Viswanathan Anand said the country currently has a golden generation that will only get stronger as time progresses. "There is a wave...The internet has made chess more accessible to everyone," said Anand. He also named the teen trio of R Praggnanandhaa, Arjun Erigaisi and D Gukesh while talking about the next generation of Indian chess stars.

21.title: Terrorists shoot 2 labourers from Uttar Pradesh in J&K, 1 critical
21.article_body: Two residents of Uttar Pradesh, both of whom are labourers, were shot at by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Saturday. The victims have been identified as Chota Prasad, a resident of Gorakhpur, and Govind, a resident of Kushinagar. Both of them were shifted to a hospital for treatment. One of them is in a critical condition.

22.title: Journalist asks Babar Azam question on IPL, he looks at Pakistan media manager
22.article_body: During the press conference ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 final between England and Pakistan, a journalist asked Babar Azam a question on IPL. Following the question, Babar looked at his media manager, refusing to answer the question. The media manager then responded, "We are taking questions on the World Cup final at the moment."

23.title: Rohit Sharma looked depressed during T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar
23.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma looked "depressed" and "off" during the T20 World Cup in Australia. "We all knew that Rohit wanted to be the skipper. But this is not an easy task to do. You have to live and breathe captaincy and also have to sacrifice family life," Akhtar said.

24.title: Under Matthew Hayden's guidance, Pak are a better unit: Brett Lee
24.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee said that under the guidance of his former teammate and Pakistan team's mentor, Matthew Hayden, the Babar Azam-led side is a better unit. "He's (Hayden) always been a leader. He's always been a person that speaks from the heart and a person that will call it out if it's not right...There's so much transparency," Lee said.

25.title: Nirmala Sitharaman should focus on economy, not Baramati: NCP
25.article_body: NCP commented on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman amid reports of her planning to visit Baramati, which is represented by NCP leader Supriya Sule in the Lok Sabha, again. "Sitharaman is concentrating so much on 'B for Baramati' that she has forgotten 'E for [the] economy'," NCP spokesperson Clyde Crasto said. Notably, Sitharaman visited Baramati for three days in September 2022.

26.title: High command will soon decide on Raj leadership: Congress leader
26.article_body: Congress leader Acharya Pramod Krishnam said the party's high command would "very soon" take a decision on the leadership of Rajasthan. "The political scenario in Rajasthan is in the notice of the party high command," said Krishnam, adding that each and every MLA should abide by the high command's decision. Krishnam is reportedly close to former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot.

27.title: SC issues notice to govt over delay in appointment of judges
27.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has issued a notice to the Ministry of Law and Justice and sought its response over the delay in appointing judges. The court noted 10 recommendations were pending for appointing a High Court judge. "Unless the bench is adorned by competent lawyers, the very concept of the Rule of Law and Justice suffers," the court said.

28.title: India announces additional $5 mn for ASEAN-India science fund
28.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday said India will make an additional contribution of $5 million to the ASEAN-India science and technology fund. The additional funding is expected to enhance cooperation in the sectors of renewable energy, public health and smart agriculture. The ASEAN-India Science and Technology Collaboration was formally launched in 1996.

29.title: Protesters clash with police in Bolivia; demand fresh census
29.article_body: Protesters clashed with police in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, on Friday amidst a general strike and weeks of unrest. The protesters demanded a fresh census be conducted to reflect the region's increased population and get increased funding from the government. Protesters clashed using molotov cocktails, stones and sticks. Images surfaced of a farmers' union bank being looted and being set ablaze.

30.title: FTA deal has had a flat tyre since I left office, let's get it done: Ex-UK PM Johnson
30.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson called for finalising the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and UK which was targeted to be done by Diwali this year. "Let's finally deliver that free trade agreement which mysteriously seems to have developed a flat tyre since I left office," Johnson said. "I wonder what the hold-up is," he added.

31.title: Can't guarantee that I'll play another World Cup: Brazil's Neymar
31.article_body: Brazil forward Neymar said that the 2022 Qatar World Cup could be his last and he will "play it" like his last tournament. "I can't guarantee that I'll play another (World) Cup. I honestly don't know," said Neymar. The 30-year-old also said there would be a new coach for Brazil and he doesn't know if "that coach will like" him.

32.title: Actor Pawan Kalyan booked by police for sitting on roof of speeding car in Andhra
32.article_body: A case of rash driving was registered against Pawan Kalyan for a stunt, where he was seen sitting on the roof of a speeding car during his visit to a village in Andhra Pradesh. It was registered following a complaint by a motorist. The motorist apparently fell from his bike because of the driving of Pawan Kalyan's convoy of vehicles.

33.title: Blessings needed for fruitful results: Kejriwal on gods on notes appeal
33.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said he had appealed to add the pictures of deities Lakshmi and Ganesh on currency notes as god's blessings are needed to reap fruitful results. He opined that people would receive blessings if notes carry pictures of gods. "Everything boils to Karma but results will be fruitful when Lord's blessings are there," he added.

34.title: Brentford's Toney scores 98th min goal to secure 2-1 win over Man City
34.article_body: Brentford striker Ivan Toney scored twice as his side won 2-1 against defending champions Manchester City in their final Premier League game before the World Cup break. "Obviously (being left out of the England squad was), a disappointment but...I'll just keep going," said Toney. After the match was tied 1-1, Toney scored in the 98th minute to secure victory.

35.title: Elon Musk to join G20 summit in Indonesia virtually: Report
35.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk will join the G20 summit in Indonesia's Bali virtually rather than in person, CNBC Indonesia reported. "He is unable to attend because...there are incidents in US and he must be present there," an official from the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce was quoted as saying. Musk is due to speak at a business-related event.

36.title: Punjab witnesses 2,467 stubble-burning incidents in a day
36.article_body: Punjab recorded 2,467 stubble-burning incidents on Saturday with Bathinda registering 358 farm fires, the maximum. With Saturday's cases, Punjab's tally of farm fires recorded between September 15 and November 12 rose to 43,144, as per the Punjab Remote Sensing Centre. Data suggests there has been a 27% drop in stubble-burning cases as compared to the corresponding period of last year.

37.title: Giriraj Sena chief Kamal Giri Dev assassinated in Jharkhand
37.article_body: Hindu organisation Giriraj Sena's chief Kamal Giri Dev was assassinated in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district on Saturday. As per reports, Dev was standing with his friend at a chowk when three people approached him and attacked him with a bottle bomb. Thereafter, the attackers escaped from the spot. Dev was rushed to a nearby hospital, however, doctors declared him dead.

38.title: Pic of MS Dhoni with Amit Shah goes viral, people react
38.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni meeting Home Minister Amit Shah has gone viral. The duo met at an event in Chennai, marking the 75th anniversary of India Cements. Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi also joined Dhoni and Shah at the event. "What's next? Dhoni joining BJP?" a fan wrote. "Chanakya of politics meets Chanakya of cricket," wrote another.

39.title: These 32 years were like hell: Rajiv Gandhi killing convict Nalini after release
39.article_body: One of the convicts of the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, Nalini Sriharan, who was released from jail on Saturday, said, "It was a hellish experience in prison during these 32 years." She added, "My conviction that I am innocent has kept me alive all these years. Otherwise, I would've ended my life." She said she was 'framed' in the killing.

40.title: 1000 Congress leaders who voted for Tharoor will join BJP: Assam CM
40.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said he is expecting the 1,000 Congress delegates who voted for Shashi Tharoor as party President to join the BJP. "Result was known and declared even before counting of votes," said Sarma, adding that the delegates were the "only democratic people" in Congress. Mallikarjun Kharge was elected as Congress chief after polling nearly 8,000 votes.

41.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu works out in gym with cannula in one arm, shares video
41.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared a video in which she can be seen doing arm exercise with one hand while a cannula can be seen in her other arm. She also shared a picture with her fitness trainer. "Last few months you've been among the few people who has seen it all...through the weakness, through...tears, through...high dose steroid therapies," Samantha wrote.

42.title: Having a Canadian passport doesn't mean I'm any less of an Indian: Akshay Kumar
42.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Saturday said that his Canadian passport did not make him "any less of an Indian", adding, "I am very much Indian." He said this while responding to a query on the criticism over his Canadian citizenship. Kumar said he has remained in India despite getting the Canadian passport nine years ago.

43.title: Daughter of Naroda Patiya massacre convict gets BJP ticket in Guj
43.article_body: The BJP has given a ticket to the daughter of a 2002 Naroda Patiya massacre case convict for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Manoj Kukrani's daughter, 30-year-old Payal Kukrani, is an anaesthetist and has been fielded from Naroda in Ahmedabad. She's among the youngest candidates fielded by the BJP in Gujarat this time. Manoj was earlier sentenced to life imprisonment.

44.title: Scarlett to return as Black Widow in 'Avengers: Secret Wars': Reports
44.article_body: Scarlett Johansson is reportedly returning to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. According to reports, the actress will reprise her role as Natasha Romanoff aka Black Widow in 'Avengers: Secret Wars', an upcoming film which is expected to release in 2026. The film will reportedly also feature Chris Hemsworth and Benedict Cumberbatch among others in pivotal roles.

45.title: Unfortunate & condemnable: Nitish on WB minister's comment on Prez Murmu
45.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday criticised West Bengal minister Akhil Giri for his comments on President Droupadi Murmu, calling it "unfortunate and condemnable". "How can anyone make such comments on the President of India?" Kumar said, adding no one has the right to make such remarks. In a video, Akhil Giri was heard saying, "How does our President look?"

46.title: Eng beating Ind in T20 WC semifinal was spectacular: Ex-cricketer
46.article_body: After England defeated India by 10 wickets in the T20 World Cup semifinal on Thursday, ex-cricketer Kevin Pietersen said that the English team's "performance ranks right up there". "It was convincing as anything because that Indian team is star-studded. To beat them as convincingly as they did was spectacular. They didn't let India into the game at all," Pietersen said.

47.title: Rahul Gandhi may miss Parliament's winter session: Congress
47.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is expected to miss the Parliament's upcoming winter session because of the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, the party said on Saturday. The winter session is likely to start in December's first week and will conclude by the month's end. Other Congress leaders KC Venugopal and Digvijaya Singh are also expected to miss the session.

48.title: Farmers should get fertilisers easily, no shortage in state: MP CM
48.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Friday said that farmers of the state should get fertilisers easily. If the distribution system is lacking, it should be fixed, he said, adding that there's  no shortage of fertilisers in the state. His comment came after he held discussions with the collectors of districts facing problems with the distribution of fertilisers.

49.title: 147-member Pak delegation visits Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in Delhi
49.article_body: A 147-member religious delegation from Pakistan on Saturday visited the Hazrat Nizamuddin Aulia Dargah in New Delhi and offered a "chaddar" at the Sufi shrine, the Pakistani High Commission in India said in a tweet. The delegation, led by an official from Pakistan's Ministry of Religious Affairs and Interfaith Harmony, arrived in New Delhi from Islamabad on November 7.

50.title: I'm not stealing from anyone: Akshay on being trolled for doing too many films
50.article_body: Akshay Kumar, reacting to being trolled for doing 'too many films' in a year, said, "Who questions someone for working a lot?" "I do four films a year...I do ads...I work, but I'm not stealing from anyone," he said, adding, "I'll work, who won't if they've...chance to...work? I'll do four films...I'll give 50 days if required and...90 days if needed."

51.title: Ananya Panday shares childhood pic with Aryan Khan on his 25th b'day
51.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories on Saturday to wish Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan on his 25th birthday. She shared an unseen picture of them together from their childhood, and wrote, "Missing baby Aryan. Happy birthday to my first and forever best friend." Aryan's sister Suhana Khan also wished him on his birthday.

52.title: Shah urges TN govt to impart technical, medical education in Tamil
52.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Saturday urged the Tamil Nadu government to impart technical and medical education in Tamil, saying it would be "a great service to the promotion of the language". He further said the move would help students understand lessons better. Students in several states are already reaping benefits from receiving higher education in regional languages, he added.

53.title: Ambedkar would be horrified by today's caste entrenchment: Tharoor
53.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said there is greater consciousness of caste in Indian society today compared to the 1950s. "Ambedkar wanted to completely destroy the caste system and he [would] probably be horrified to realize that...(it) is more and more entrenched," said Tharoor. He added that parties against discrimination or untouchability nonetheless seek votes in the name of caste.

54.title: Mysuru to get 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan: Congress MLA
54.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Tanveer Sait said a 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan would be erected in Mysuru's Srirangapatna. "The BJP government has been distorting the history around Tipu Sultan," said Sait, adding that the statue will represent "actual history". Former CM Siddaramaiah backed the announcement and asked why a statue can't be built for the 18th-century warrior.

55.title: NCP leader Awhad gets bail in case for disrupting film screening
55.article_body: A local court in Thane on Saturday granted bail to Nationalist Congress Party leader Jitendra Awhad and 11 others in a case that alleges they disrupted the screening of the Marathi film 'Har Har Mahadev'. The former state minister and his supporters were arrested on Friday for disrupting the movie's screening at a mall in Thane city on November 7.

56.title: Aurobindo Pharma's Q2 net profit drops 41% to ₹409 cr
56.article_body: Aurobindo Pharma reported a 41% year-over-year decline in its consolidated net profit at ₹409 crore for the second quarter ended September. The drug firm's revenue also declined to ₹5,739 crore as against ₹5,942 crore in the year-ago period. Earlier on Thursday, the Enforcement Directorate arrested Aurobindo's Director Sarath Reddy for alleged involvement in the Delhi liquor policy scam.

57.title: 3 Bihar men held for making fake Patanjali websites, cheating people
57.article_body: Three people were arrested from Bihar for posing as representatives of Patanjali Yog Gram in Uttarakhand's Haridwar and cheating people seeking Ayurvedic treatment, police said on Saturday. Twenty fake websites that resembled the official Patanjali website were identified and their details were sent to the National Internet Exchange of India to get them blocked, according to police.

58.title: World's highest polling station sees 100% turnout: Himachal officer
58.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer Mahesh Pathania said Tashigang, the world's highest polling station, saw 100% voter turnout on Saturday for state Assembly elections. This came despite temperature reaching minus 10°C in the area. Stalls with traditional food were installed at the booth. Situated at a height of 15,256 feet in Lahaul and Spiti district, Tashigang has 52 registered voters.

59.title: It will come very soon: Akshay Kumar on the status of his Indian passport
59.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while speaking at Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, shared an update regarding the status of his Indian passport. "Yes, I had said it in 2019, I applied for it. But then...pandemic happened...everything shut down for 2.5 years...Very soon my passport will come," he stated. Akshay added having a Canadian passport doesn't mean he's any less of an Indian.

60.title: I get 2-3 kgs 'gaali' daily, convert it into nutrition: PM in T'gana
60.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing BJP workers at the Begumpet Airport in Hyderabad on Saturday, said, "I get 2-3 kg of 'gaali' (abuse) every day...All such abuses in my stomach get converted into nutrition." "They (Opposition) have exhausted their dictionary of abuse...They do it because they have nothing else to offer," PM Modi added.

61.title: Farmer's house robbed at gunpoint in Nashik, valuables worth ₹8.50 lakh stolen
61.article_body: A group of five to six unidentified men allegedly entered a farmer's house and robbed his family at gunpoint in Maharashtra's Nashik district, police said on Saturday. The incident reportedly took place on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. The accused escaped with 280 gm gold, 480 gm silver ornaments and cash, all worth ₹8.50 lakh, police added.

62.title: What will happen if T20 World Cup 2022 final gets washed out due to rain tomorrow?
62.article_body: Pakistan-England T20 World Cup 2022 final will take place on Sunday. There must be at least 10 overs bowled to side batting second (unless result is achieved sooner) for an official result. If rain doesn't allow the match to be completed on Sunday, it'll continue on Monday. Pakistan and England will be declared joint-winners if rain washes out reserve day.

63.title: Let's accept that we did not put up a good total: Sachin on India losing T20 WC 2022 semi
63.article_body: Referring to India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final defeat against England, Sachin Tendulkar said, "I know that the semi-final was really disappointing." Talking about India's total of 168, Sachin said, "Let's accept that we did not put up a good total on the board." He added India should have made around 190 given the dimensions of Adelaide.

64.title: Ukrainian police officers, broadcast services return to Kherson
64.article_body: Ukrainian police officers on Saturday returned to duty in Kherson following the withdrawal of Russian forces from the city, Ukraine's national police chief confirmed. Ukrainian TV and radio services have also reportedly resumed in the formerly Russian-occupied city. The Ukrainian military said it was overseeing "stabilization measures" in surrounding areas to make sure the city was safe.

65.title: Ranveer, Alia's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' to release in April 2023
65.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Saturday announced the release date of his upcoming directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', a film which stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt in the lead roles. The film will arrive in theatres on April 28, 2023. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will also feature Jaya Bachchan, Shabana Azmi and Dharmendra.

66.title: SC verdict to release Rajiv Gandhi case convicts has hurt sentiments: Baghel
66.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM and Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel said that the release of six convicts by the Supreme Court in the former PM Rajiv Gandhi assassination case has hurt the sentiments of crores of people. "Congress national spokesperson Jairam Ramesh also gave a statement...it should not have happened," Baghel said. "The convicts were released before time," Baghel added.

67.title: Australian gets 129-yr jail term for raping kids including 18-month-old in Philippines
67.article_body: A man known as 'Australia's worst pedophile' has been sentenced to 129 years in jail in the Philippines for rape and sexual abuse of children including an 18-month-old baby. This was the second conviction of Peter Gerard Scully, who is already serving a life sentence for numerous offences including child pornography. Scully held and abused eight children in the Philippines.

68.title: Set up dengue hospital in each UP district: CM Yogi to officials
68.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath held a high-level meeting to review the dengue situation in Uttar Pradesh and asked officials to set up a dedicated hospital in every district. He also directed all ministers to be on the field and said every patient should be given proper treatment. On Friday, the Allahabad HC pulled up the state government for the dengue menace.

69.title: Shweta Bachchan says her children make fun of her menopause
69.article_body: Shweta Bachchan opened up about going through menopause and said her children, Navya and Agastya Nanda, make jokes about it. "If I'm in...bad mood, and I shout at them, they'll say, 'Mom is menopausing today.' That's not fair...For you, it's a joke, but think about it for me, everything is going south," Shweta said in an episode of Navya's podcast.

70.title: Forex reserve is not a showpiece, but to use on rainy day: RBI Guv
70.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that foreign exchange reserves have to be used to ensure there is no undue exchange rate volatility. "We didn't pick the reserves just to keep it as a showpiece. We picked it only for this rainy day," he added. "There were some observations made that RBI is using reserves indiscriminately. It's not so," Das said.

71.title: Will hire best lawyers to get Article 370 & 35A restored: Bukhari
71.article_body: J&K Apni Party President Altaf Bukhari said the organisation will hire the country's best lawyers to approach the Supreme Court for the restoration of Articles 370 and 35A. "Our state, as it existed on August 5, 2019, should be restored," said Bukhari. He added that his party will collect details of youths in J&K jails and seek their release.

72.title: Sexual assault cases to be reviewed within 1 month: Uttarakhand CM
72.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Saturday stated that complaints of sexual assault and domestic violence against women in the state would be examined within one month. He claimed action will be taken against government officials who don't work on such issues. Further, he launched a self-registration option on Uttarakhand Police App for women working in government and non-government offices.

73.title: Delhivery's Q2 revenue rises 20% YoY to ₹1,796 cr, net loss narrows 60%
73.article_body: Logistics company Delhivery's consolidated revenue in July-September quarter grew around 20% year-over-year to ₹1,796 crore as against ₹1,497.7 crore from the year-ago period. Delhivery's net loss in the second quarter narrowed 60% to ₹254.1 crore against the loss of ₹635 crore reported in the same period last year. The revenue from express parcel services grew 17% year-over-year to ₹1,125 crore.

74.title: Ex-guard at UK's Berlin embassy pleads guilty to spying for Russia
74.article_body: A former security guard at the British embassy in Berlin has pleaded guilty to spying for Russia and faces a maximum prison sentence of 14 years. David Ballantyne Smith provided confidential information about British civil servants to Russia's military attache in Berlin, British prosecutors said. They claim Smith was angry over the embassy's show of support for the LGBTQ+ community.

75.title: Himachal records 65.92% voter turnout till 5 pm: Election Commission
75.article_body: Himachal Pradesh recorded a voter turnout of 65.92% till 5 pm on Saturday, according to the Election Commission of India. Shillai recorded the highest turnout at 77%, while Sarkaghat recorded the lowest 55.40% among the 68 Assembly constituencies in the state, the poll panel added. "Elections were peaceful in all the segments," state Office of CEO's Joint Director Media said.

76.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
76.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Saturday, with Bihar's Motihari, Siwan and Darbhanga having the highest AQI at 419, 417 and 404, respectively. This is followed by Bettiah (394), Katihar (385), Purnia (379), Saharsa (372), Begusarai (370), Chhapra (368), Samastipur (348), Bhagalpur (325), Araria (316) and Bihar Sharif (314).

77.title: Buttler, Babar pose with T20 WC 2022 trophy on roof of MCG, ICC shares pics
77.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler and Pakistan captain Babar Azam posed with T20 World Cup 2022 trophy on roof of the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) ahead of the final. The ICC shared pictures on Instagram, writing, "Pakistan and England have scaled the heights to reach the final...Who will come out on top at the MCG?" The final will take place tomorrow.

78.title: Jos Buttler, Babar Azam pick their Player of T20 World Cup 2022
78.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler and Pakistan captain Babar Azam, whose teams will face each other in T20 World Cup 2022 final, have picked their Player of the Tournament. Buttler chose Suryakumar Yadav, saying, "He's been incredibly eye-catching to watch in such a star-studded line-up. To stand out the way he has is amazing." Meanwhile, Babar chose his compatriot Shadab Khan.

79.title: Pay attention to PM Modi's empty promises made during Hyd speech: TRS MLC
79.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha urged the people of the state to pay attention to the empty promises made by PM Narendra Modi during his speech in Hyderabad on Saturday. She claimed that PM Modi had once again failed to explain the role the BJP-led Centre had played in Telangana's development. "People need to be aware of...BJP's dishonest strategies," she added.

80.title: Akshay confirms his exit from Hera Pheri 3, says 'Wasn't satisfied with script'
80.article_body: Akshay Kumar has confirmed that he's not a part of 'Hera Pheri 3'. "I wasn't satisfied with the script. I have to do what people want to see. That is why I backed out," he said. Paresh Rawal recently confirmed that Kartik Aaryan has been roped in for the third instalment. Reportedly, Kartik will play the role of Raju now.

81.title: BJP govt delaying J&K Assembly polls to continue proxy rule: AAP leader
81.article_body: AAP leader Harsh Dev Singh on Saturday claimed that BJP-led government was delaying the Assembly elections in Jammu and Kashmir to deny people their democratic rights and to continue its proxy rule. The silence of the Centre and Election Commission on Jammu and Kashmir while announcing elections for Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat amply revealed the government's intention, Singh said.

82.title: Will provide 500 units of free electricity if elected: J&K Apni Party
82.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Apni Party President Altaf Bukhari on Saturday said his party will give 500 units of free electricity in Jammu in summer and Kashmir in winter if elected to power. Addressing a public rally at Sher-i-Kashmir Cricket Stadium in Srinagar, Bukhari said, "The day Apni Party will form its government, we'll provide employment to youth of Kashmir."

83.title: US seeks 15 years in prison for Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes
83.article_body: US Department of Justice recommended Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes should spend 15 years in prison and pay $800 million. Holmes was found guilty on four counts of wire fraud and conspiracy related to her now-defunct blood-testing startup. She faces up to 20 years in prison for each count. Earlier, Holmes urged a California judge to not send her to prison.

84.title: 4 dead bodies found in German town; murder-suicide suspected
84.article_body: Four dead bodies were recovered from three separate locations in Germany's Weilheim town on Friday, including the body of a 59-year-old man who is believed to have killed the other three individuals, according to police. Police found the bodies of two of the victims while searching the man's house. Investigators believe the suspect inflicted fatal injuries on himself, police informed.

85.title: Tremors felt across Delhi, other areas as 5.4 magnitude quake hits Nepal; 2nd in a week
85.article_body: Tremors were felt across Delhi and its neighbouring areas on Saturday as a 5.4 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal. This is the second time that tremors have been felt this week. Previously, strong tremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and several other parts of North India on Wednesday as a 6.3-magnitude earthquake had hit Nepal at around 2 am.

86.title: Vehicle carrying 25 tourists overturns due to landslide in Kerala
86.article_body: A tempo traveller carrying 25 tourists overturned after getting trapped under mud and debris due to a landslide in Kerala's Kundala following heavy rainfall. One person, believed to be the tempo's driver, is suspected to be trapped under debris. The incident reportedly took place after the vehicle lost control when water gushed towards it from one side of the road.

87.title: AAP releases 15th list of candidates for Gujarat Assembly elections
87.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday released its 15th list of three candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has fielded Mahendra Rajput from the Sidhpur constituency and Lalji Parmar from the Matar constituency. Mahendra Patil has been fielded from Udhana. The Arvind Kejriwal-led party will contest in the elections from all 182 seats in the state.

88.title: Who is 13-year-old singer Janaki who'll perform during T20 World Cup final tomorrow?
88.article_body: Indian-origin singer Janaki Easwar will perform along with the Australian rock band Icehouse during the T20 World Cup final at Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday. The 13-year-old rose to fame last year by becoming the youngest-ever contestant of the reality show 'The Voice Australia'. Her parents hail from Kozhikode in Kerala and have been in Australia for 15 years.

89.title: Republican control of US Senate will help Turkey's F-16 buy: Erdogan
89.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Saturday said Turkey's efforts to complete its purchase of F-16 fighter jets would become "much easier" if Republicans ended up controlling the US Senate, Turkish media reported. Meanwhile, Democrat Senator Mark Kelly's re-election from the US state of Arizona has left Democrats one seat away from securing control of the Senate after Tuesday's elections.

90.title: Teaching job aspirant claims Kolkata policewoman bit her, probe on
90.article_body: Two days after a teaching job aspirant claimed she was bitten on one hand by a woman police officer, Kolkata Police on Friday ordered an inquiry into the allegation. Police said the victim was part of a demonstration in Camac Street on Wednesday seeking appointment in schools. She was arrested during the protest and released on bail the next day.

91.title: I’m predicting a comfortable win for Eng in T20 WC final: Kevin
91.article_body: Former English batter Kevin Pietersen said that he is predicting a comfortable win for England against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday. "One thing that can happen to this England team [is] they can get rolled over for none...That's what Pakistan need to hope for, because I don't think they can derail England themselves," Pietersen said.

92.title: Hinduja family reach 'confidential' agreement in UK court proceedings
92.article_body: UK-based Hinduja brothers, who were locked in a legal dispute in UK courts over their billionaire family assets, reached a "confidential" agreement, according to a Court of Appeal ruling in London on Friday. The case is related to the family's maxim "everything belongs to everyone and nothing belongs to anyone" and has been through protracted legal proceedings since November 2019.

93.title: Indian team needs a new breed of players: Former India pacer
93.article_body: Former Indian pacer Atul Wassan commented after India lost to England by 10 wickets in the semifinal match of the T20 World Cup on Thursday. "This game has proved again and again that you need a new breed. In 2007, we hardly had stars...and won the title. We are relying too much on our bigger names to deliver," Wassan said.

94.title: Bengaluru to receive light rainfall till November 15: IMD
94.article_body: After receiving 0.7 mm of rainfall on Saturday morning, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said Bengaluru will witness light rainfall till November 15. The met department also announced a yellow alert for the coastal region of Karnataka, including Dakshina Kannada and Udupi, and south interior Karnataka till November 13. Notably, since October 1, Bengaluru has received 347 mm of rainfall.

95.title: It was a nightmare: Elizabeth Hurley recalls working with Matthew Perry
95.article_body: British actress-model Elizabeth Hurley recalled working with Matthew Perry in 'Serving Sara' while the 'Friends' actor battled substance abuse and underwent rehab. "It was a nightmare working with him at that time and, as it's...known, our movie was shut down because of his addiction," she said. Elizabeth added while "that was a little tough", when Matthew returned "he was fabulous".

96.title: My son is not interested in movies, wants to do fashion designing: Akshay
96.article_body: Akshay Kumar has revealed that his son Aarav has no interest in movies. He added, "I want to show [him] films, I want to tell him about films, he doesn't want to see films." "I want to put him into all that but he just doesn't want to see anything...He wants to study or do his fashion designing," said Akshay.

97.title: Why didn't we hire AB de Villiers for T20 WC as mentor: Ex-player
97.article_body: Former cricketer Atul Wassan asked why ex-South African batter AB de Villiers was not hired as a mentor for the Indian team during the T20 World Cup. "We can't have the same coaching staff for the T20 and Test cricket...[De Villiers] could have guided the team better. He can tell the players a bit about manufacturing the shots," Wassan said.

98.title: Delhi HC issues bailable warrants against Yamuna floodplain residents
98.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has issued bailable warrants against the residents of Moolchand basti in Yamuna floodplains, Rajghat, for failing to comply with its earlier directives. "All the petitioners are residing on...Yamuna floodplains...in respect of which various injunctions stand issued by competent authorities and mandate the removal of all encroachments," the court said.

99.title: Nearly 4,000 people fined for violating emission rules in Delhi
99.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police has fined nearly 4,000 people from Tuesday to Friday this week for using diesel BS-IV or petrol BS-III vehicles, which have been banned till November 13 to check air pollution. The ban is part of the Graded Response Action Plan, Stage 3, imposed by the Commission for Air Quality Management. Fines up to ₹20,000 were imposed.

100.title: CBI books Mumbai private firm for cheating banks of ₹464 crore
100.article_body: A Mumbai-based company and its directors have been booked by the CBI for allegedly causing a loss of ₹464.41 crore to a nine-bank consortium led by SBI. The company is accused of disproportionately increasing its debtors and inventory to then write off the debts. The company, located in Prabhadevi, is engaged in the printing and trading of paper.

101.title: 2 arrested for attempted murder during Ganpati immersion in Pune
101.article_body: Pune City Police arrested two persons for allegedly attempting to murder a man two months ago during the Ganpati immersion procession. Police said the accused Siddharth Kamble (22) and Adnan Bagwan (21) had attacked the complainant with a sharp object on September 10 in Bhavani Peth. The attack is reported to have been motivated by a past dispute.

102.title: It is the best in the world: Zerodha CEO on Bengaluru airport
102.article_body: India's largest stockbroker Zerodha's CEO Nikhil Kamath has said that Bengaluru airport is not just the best one in India, but the best in the world. Praising Kempegowda International Airport's CEO Hari Marar, Kamath tweeted, "My friend...you've outdone yourself." He added, "Your (Marar's) vision and dedication to this city we...call home has made all of us so proud."

103.title: We had to change sanitary pads behind bushes during outdoor shoots: Jaya Bachchan
103.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan recalled the time when there were no vanity vans for actors and no facilities at outdoor locations. She added that they had to change everything behind the bushes, including sanitary pads. "You...carried plastic bags to discard the pads and put them in...basket so that when you get home, you can get rid of it," Jaya stated.

104.title: Raj woman gang-raped in front of husband by 4 men; 3 accused held
104.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by four men in front of her husband in Rajasthan's Sirohi district, police said on Saturday. The four men had entered the couple's home with the intention to rob them, police added. "They stripped the man and took ₹1,400 from him," Pindwara DSP said. Three of the accused persons were arrested on Saturday.

105.title: World population to reach 8 billion mark in 3 days
105.article_body: The global population is projected to reach the 8 billion mark on 15 November 2022, the United Nations (UN) said. It added that India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023. The population of the world could reach 8.5 billion people in 2030 and by 2050, it will reach 9.7 billion, it said.

106.title: PM Modi-led govt doesn't sign FTA just for the sake of it: Piyush Goyal
106.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led BJP government doesn't sign Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) just for the sake of it. "India's interests are weighed upon...We analyse whether it is fair and equitable," Goyal said. "In the past several deals were struck, but without keeping India's interest in mind," he further said.

107.title: Pakistan bowling performances are way better than India: Inzamam
107.article_body: Former cricketer Inzamam-ul-Haq said that the Pakistan team's bowling performances in the T20 World Cup in Australia have been "way better" than Indian ones. "India face problems whenever there is a big match and I have been observing this since the Asia Cup...However, we will not perform like this (India's performance against England) in the final," Inzamam said.

108.title: Will not support MVA panel in SPPU senate polls: Congress
108.article_body: The Congress party students' wing has extended support to 'Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Parivartan' (CSMP) for Savitribai Phule Pune University's (SPPU) management council senate polls, instead of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA). The CSMP is formed by independent candidates. Congress student leaders said Shiv Sena and Nationalist Congress Party did not consult them while finalising list of candidates.

109.title: 15 trees chopped off in Greater Noida without forest department nod
109.article_body: More than 15 trees were felled in Greater Noida's Sector Beta 2 on Friday without prior permission from the forest department, residents said. Residents and environmental activists have alleged that the trees were felled by some of the residents themselves. Greater Noida Authority officials said that they are trying to identify the residents involved in the felling of the trees.

110.title: 2 die, including 13-yr-old boy, after jeep overturns in Rajasthan
110.article_body: Two people were killed when the jeep in which they were travelling overturned after one of its tyres burst in the Manpur area of Dausa, Rajasthan. The deceased were identified as Shubham (13) and Lalluram (55), police said. The jeep was carrying school students for a picnic. Notably, five other people, including four students, were injured in the accident.

111.title: India is going to be global superpower in 25 years: Piyush Goyal
111.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said that the world has recognised that "India has arrived". "The headline is India is going to be a global superpower in next 25 years," Goyal said. "Every statistics...will clearly show you upward of a $30 trillion economy when we celebrate 100 years of Independence," he further added.

112.title: Bike-borne men fake an accident to extort ₹15,000 from B'luru car owner
112.article_body: Police arrested two men on Saturday for allegedly faking an accident and extorting ₹15,000 from the owner of a car in Bengaluru. A CCTV footage showed the men hitting the car with their hands as the four-wheeler passed their bike. Later, they allegedly demanded money from the victim and threatened to file a complaint against him for dashing their bike.

113.title: Had rejected Salman for Maine Pyar Kiya after 1st screen test: Sooraj
113.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya, in an interview, revealed that Salman Khan was rejected for 'Maine Pyar Kiya' after his first screen test. "But there was something about him. So, five months later, we got him on board," he added. Sooraj further said his first script for the film was rejected and it took him two years to write a new one.

114.title: Bengaluru airport is now second-largest in India: Karnataka CM
114.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said that with the inauguration of Terminal 2 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, the airport has become the second-largest airport in India. The terminal, spread over an area of 2,55,645 square metres, has been built at a cost of around ₹5,000 crore. It is expected to double the passenger handling capacity of the airport.

115.title: 1.5 kg heroin packed in soap cases seized in Assam's Karimganj, 1 held
115.article_body: The Assam Police on Friday night seized 1.5 kg heroin and arrested one person in Karimganj district, police said. In the operation led by the Additional Superintendent of Police of Karimganj, they seized heroin packed in 117 soap cases, police added. "The market value of the seized drugs is estimated at around ₹5 crore," police said.

116.title: Remains of NASA spacecraft found 37 years after it exploded & killed 7 astronauts
116.article_body: NASA has confirmed the discovery of the debris from its Challenger space shuttle which had exploded 73 seconds after liftoff on 28 January 1986, killing all seven astronauts onboard. Remains of the World War II-era aircraft were found after a TV documentary crew spotted an artifact on the seafloor off the coast of Florida in the US in May.

117.title: Actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi cremated in Mumbai; daughter performs last rites
117.article_body: Actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, who passed away at the age of 46 on Friday, was cremated in Mumbai on Saturday. Siddhaanth's 18-year-old daughter Diza performed her father's last rites. Several actors including Jay Bhanushali, Arti Singh, Jaswir Kaur, Rohit K Verma, Vivek Mushran and Amit Behl attended the funeral.

118.title: Irfan Pathan responds to Pakistan PM's 'This Sunday, it is 152/0 vs 170/0' tweet
118.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan responded to Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's 'So, this Sunday, it's 152/0 vs 170/0' tweet. Irfan tweeted, "The difference between us is that we're happy with ourselves, while you look for happiness when others are in trouble. That's why you aren't concentrating on your country's well-being." Sharif had referred to India's 10-wicket losses against Pakistan & England.

119.title: Sisodia changed 140 phones to destroy evidence in Delhi liquor policy scam: ED
119.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and other 'VIPs' accused in the Delhi liquor policy scam case changed 140 phones to destroy digital evidence linked to the case, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has said. Around 30 people have been accused of involvement. The agency also said the liquor policy was "leaked" to some liquor manufacturers much before it was introduced.

120.title: Rachakonda Police grow Miyawaki plantation with 40,000 saplings
120.article_body: Rachakonda Police Commissioner MM Bhagwat on Friday visited a Miyawaki plantation in Hyderabad, where he had planted 40,000 saplings 15 months ago. The plantation now has turned into a dense forest spread over four acres and the saplings have now grown to a height of 15 feet. "They were grown with a 100% drip irrigation facility," Bhagwat said.

121.title: Inflation above 6% can be detrimental to India's growth: RBI Guv Das
121.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that inflation between 4% and 6% can help the central bank keep the monetary policy supportive of the economy. "Any inflation above 6% can be detrimental to India's growth," Das added. He further said that RBI expects October's inflation rates to be below 7%. "Macroeconomic fundamentals of India remain strong and resilient," Das said.

122.title: Indian Reserve Battalion personnel kills colleague in Arunachal
122.article_body: An Indian Reserve Battalion (IRBn) personnel deployed at Rajiv Gandhi University in Arunachal Pradesh's Doimukh, near Itanagar, allegedly shot dead one of his colleagues, police said. According to police, a head constable of 2nd IRBn Diyun fired two rounds at the victim, purportedly after a heated argument on Friday. Police have dismissed the theory that the accused was mentally unstable.

123.title: 11-yr-old boy dies after compound wall of bus depot falls on him in Palghar
123.article_body: A boy died and another got injured after a portion of the compound wall at Jawhar bus depot in Palghar, Maharashtra, fell on them. The 11-year-old deceased and the 15-year-old injured were waiting for an autorickshaw near the compound wall when a bus hit the wall, police said. Both boys belonged to the same family and had come from Rajkot.

124.title: Jaipur International Airport Ltd receives aerodrome licence from DGCA
124.article_body: Jaipur International Airport Limited (JIAL) has received the aerodrome licence from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA). Prior to this, the Airport Authority of India (AAI) was the licence holder. Adani Group, which is operating the Jaipur airport since October 2021, has become the new licence holder. The company said that it is now looking for expansion.

125.title: Pantaloons offers Flat 30%* off amid Mid Season Sale
125.article_body: Pantaloons shared that its Mid Season Sale featuring deals & offers at flat 30%* off is live from 11th November to 27th November. The brand aims to encourage customers to wear latest fashionable outfits, and choose from a wide range of categories like shirts, dresses, footwear & more. This offer is valid on select range of their exclusive brands.

126.title: Don't make it a political issue: Anil Agarwal on shifting Foxconn plant to Guj
126.article_body: On shifting the Foxconn semiconductor plant from Maharashtra to Gujarat, Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal warned against the politicisation of the issue. Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, Agarwal said, "A complete ecosystem has to be created...We are just making fundamental raw materials...Please don't make it a political issue. India is one and let us make the raw material."

127.title: EC subverted to an extent that it's no more an independent body: Mufti
127.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Saturday accused the BJP of subverting the Election Commission to an extent that it was no more an independent body. "Our election commissioners were invited by other countries to seek...advice on conducting elections," Mufti said. Elections in Jammu and Kashmir will be held only when the BJP gives a go ahead for it, Mufti added.

128.title: BMC to float tender for reconstruction of Mumbai's Gokhale bridge
128.article_body: After the closure of Gokhale bridge, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said the tenders for constructing the new bridge will be floated on Saturday. "IIT Bombay has already cleared the General Arrangement Drawings (GAD) and we're expecting to issue...work order by...first week of December," a BMC official said. The construction of the new bridge will reportedly take around six-seven months.

129.title: Startups should give solutions for India's logistics ecosystem: Sitharaman
129.article_body: While addressing YourStory's TechSparks event, India's Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that startups should give solutions for India's logistics ecosystem, storage and preservations, adding that there are so many areas where India needs innovation. "Startups in India must think about sources of financing, platform for growth...people to engage with," Sitharaman added.

130.title: NGT seeks Punjab govt's reply on 'noise pollution' by CNG pump
130.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has sought a reply from the Punjab government over the alleged noise pollution caused by a CNG pump station situated on Zirakpur-Banur road. A plea had claimed that the huge noise caused by the CNG pump station is an underestimated threat. The plea also sought the issuance of directions to the state to shift the pump.

131.title: Amazon to review unprofitable units, workers told to find other jobs in firm: Report
131.article_body: Amazon is going to review its unprofitable businesses and has asked employees to look for other jobs in the company, Daily Mail reported. A software engineer at Amazon Robotics AI, Jamie Zhang, posted on LinkedIn that he and his entire team have been fired. Amazon's Alexa business recorded an operating loss of over $5 billion a year, the report mentioned.

132.title: Delhi woman tries to sacrifice 2-month-old kid to bring back her dead dad
132.article_body: In a bid to "bring back" her dead father, a woman kidnapped a two-month-old child in Delhi and tried to sacrifice the infant. She was stopped by the police. Police said that the child was safely rescued. The woman was earlier also involved in other crimes, police added. She had met the baby's mother at Safdarjung Hospital.

133.title: DRI arrests Indian with 5 kg heroin worth ₹35 cr at Mumbai airport
133.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested an Indian national carrying 4.98 kg of heroin worth ₹35 crore at the Mumbai international airport. The accused, travelling from Nairobi to Mumbai, had concealed the narcotics in a false cavity created in his trolley bag. The DRI said a further investigation is underway to unearth and neutralise the international drug smuggling syndicate.

134.title: Bipasha Basu shares first post after welcoming baby girl; names her 'Devi'
134.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu took to Instagram to share first post after welcoming baby girl with her husband, actor Karan Singh Grover. Revealing that they named her 'Devi Basu Singh Grover', the couple wrote, "Physical manifestation of our love and blessings of Ma is here...and she's Divine." The post also included a picture showing Bipasha and Karan holding Devi's feet.

135.title: Preity Zinta celebrates 18 years of 'Veer-Zaara', pens note
135.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post marking 18 years since the release of her musical-drama film 'Veer-Zaara'. "There have been movies and there will be movies but nothing compares to Veer-Zaara...Thank you Aditya Chopra for creating the world of Veer-Zaara," she wrote. The Yash Chopra directorial also starred Shah Rukh Khan and Rani Mukerji.

136.title: Jairam Thakur will continue to be the CM face in Himachal: JP Nadda
136.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda confirmed that the current Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Jairam Thakur, will continue to be the CM face of the state if the party wins the Assembly polls. "We definitely are in a comfortable majority...[Congress] will gain nothing in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. Once they feel they are winning...they all will come...for credit," Nadda said.

137.title: Cong promises to rename Narendra Modi stadium in Gujarat manifesto
137.article_body: Congress on Saturday released its manifesto for the upcoming Gujarat elections and promised to rename Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad. "The name of Sardar Patel stadium was changed...We want to assure the people of Gujarat that in the very first cabinet meeting, we will restore the name of the stadium to Sardar Patel stadium," a Congress leader said.

138.title: School manager booked for raping student in Ghaziabad
138.article_body: An FIR was registered against a school manager in Ghaziabad on Friday for allegedly raping a student, police said. The manager, Shahadat, has been accused of raping the girl repeatedly after school time over a period of two months, as per media reports. The accused is absconding, police informed. Raids are reportedly being conducted at his possible hideouts.

139.title: BJP should make Sukesh Chandrashekhar party president: Kejriwal
139.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Saturday the BJP should make alleged conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar the party's national president. "The BJP demands my lie-detector test and even Sukesh Chandrashekhar makes the same demand. They speak the same language. He is fully trained to join the BJP now," Kejriwal said. Chandrashekhar is the main accused in an extortion case.

140.title: Going forward, digital currency will be less costly: RBI Governor
140.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said digital currency will be less costly in the coming times and will be important for cross-border transactions and payments. Speaking at Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, Das said, "You have to keep pace with times...printing of paper notes, it involves cost—cost of printing, buying paper, logistics, storage...Going forward, digital currency will be less costly."

141.title: They are all going to be superhit films: SRK on 'Jawan', 'Dunki' & 'Pathaan'
141.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan, when asked if he's nervous about his upcoming films 'Pathaan', 'Dunki' and 'Jawan', said, "I don't think I need to be nervous." He added that they are all going to be superhit films. Shah Rukh further said it's not an "arrogant statement", adding, "It's...child-like belief that 'look...I've done my best, I'm going to pass with flying colours'."

142.title: Nitin Gadkari sanctions 7 projects worth ₹10,222 crore for Tripura
142.article_body: Union Minister of Road, Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari sanctioned seven projects worth ₹10,222 crore in Tripura. "These projects will strengthen connectivity between Tripura and other northeastern states, including neighbouring Bangladesh," said Gadkari. He also directed the state government to speed up the process of land acquisition for the expedition of the schemes.

143.title: 105-yr-old Naro Devi casts vote in Chamba's Churah in Himachal polls
143.article_body: Naro Devi, a 105-year-old woman, cast her vote in Himachal Pradesh on Saturday. She cast her vote at booth number 122 in Churah Assembly constituency located in Chamba. She decided to cast her vote at polling station despite an option of casting vote through ballot paper at home as directed by the Election Commission to all voters aged above 80.

144.title: New Zealand-based commercial lawyer Greg Barclay re-elected as Independent Chair of ICC
144.article_body: The ICC Board has unanimously re-elected Greg Barclay as the Independent Chair of the International Cricket Council (ICC) for a second two-year term. Barclay was unopposed following the withdrawal of Tavengwa Mukuhlani from the process. Barclay, an Auckland-based commercial lawyer, was originally appointed as the ICC Chair in November 2020.

145.title: Economy remains resilient, India to grow by 7% this year: RBI Guv
145.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Indian economy remains resilient and added that the central bank estimates that India will grow this year by 7%. "The growth numbers are looking good...IMF has projected that India will grow by about 6.8% in the current year...that puts India among the fastest growing major economies in the world," Das said at an event.

146.title: LockBit 3.0 hackers posted company data on 'publication platform': Thales
146.article_body: French defence and technology group Thales has said its data has been released on the "publication platform" of hacker group LockBit 3.0. The company said that there has been no intrusion of its IT systems at this stage, adding that there is currently no impact on its operations. The group has identified one of two likely sources of data theft.

147.title: Alibag tehsildar, agent caught by ACB for accepting bribe of ₹2 lakh
147.article_body: The Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) of the Navi Mumbai unit caught a tehsildar, Minal Dalavi, of Alibag and one of her agents, Rakesh Chavan, for accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh. According to reports, the complainant was trying to get a 7/12 extract mutated in favour of his father-in-law. While Chavan has been nabbed, Minal is yet to be arrested.

148.title: Men carrying ₹3 cr gold paste in undergarments caught at Hyd airport
148.article_body: Customs officials have seized gold worth ₹3 crore from two passengers at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. Amir Khan and Mohd Qureshi, who had arrived at the airport from Dubai, had converted 5.5 kg of gold into paste form to avoid detection by authorities. They had concealed the gold in undergarments.

149.title: MUHS starts its 1st genetic lab & cancer research centre in Pune
149.article_body: Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) on Friday launched its first genetic laboratory and cancer research centre, MUHS GeneHealth, in Pune to provide affordable care with additional discounts for patients from poor financial backgrounds. The facility was inaugurated by state Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari. "Various tests will be conducted through this genetic lab," Koshyari said.

150.title: SRK stopped at Mumbai airport for carrying expensive watches; paid ₹6.83 lakh: Reports
150.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan was stopped at the Mumbai airport by customs officials as he returned from Sharjah, according to reports. The actor was carrying watches worth ₹18 lakh, reports added. Shah Rukh Khan, who was travelling in a chartered plane, was reportedly made to pay ₹6.83 lakh as customs duty.

151.title: BJP workers inspire me as they are fighting oppressive TRS govt: PM in T'gana
151.article_body: PM Narendra Modi criticised the ruling TRS government in Telangana, saying that BJP workers inspire him because they are fighting an oppressive state government. "The ruling party leaders have been indulging in unjust practices with the rich talents of the region. The party that the [people of the state] trusted has deceived them the most," said PM Modi.

152.title: Ukraine builds barbed-wired wall on border with Belarus: Kyiv
152.article_body: Ukraine has said that it was building a reinforced concrete wall and other fortifications along the border with Belarus, a Russian ally. Ukrainian Presidential advisor Kyrylo Tymoshenko said a 3 km barbed-wire-topped wall had been built on the border with Belarus. He added that sandbags and trenches have also been used and other work is also underway in the region.

153.title: Shoaib Malik linked with Pakistani actress Ayesha amid rumours of divorce with Sania
153.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Malik has been linked with Pakistani actress Ayesha Omar amid rumours of divorce with Indian tennis player Sania Mirza. Pictures of Malik and Ayesha from an intimate photoshoot that was conducted last year have gone viral on social media. As per reports, Shoaib and Sania will announce their separation after resolving legal issues.

154.title: Rare 'sprite lightning' seen over Tropical Storm Nicole, footage surfaces
154.article_body: A photographer named Frankie Lucena captured a rare phenomenon called 'sprite lightning', which occurred amid Tropical Storm Nicole over Puerto Rico. 'Sprite lightning', which is also known as 'red lightning' because of its reddish hue, is formed from pent-up electricity in clouds shooting vertically. Lucena shared a video of the phenomenon on Twitter.

155.title: 2 high-speed bikes collide into one another in MP, video surfaces
155.article_body: A video has surfaced from Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur showing a collision between two speeding bikes on Thursday. The video shows one of the riders being thrown away at a distance from his bike. The accident happened as the speeding biker couldn't stop at an intersection when the second two-wheeler was crossing it. Both the riders are reportedly out of danger.

156.title: Meta layoffs were 'more thoughtful' than Twitter under Musk, says Zuckerberg: Report
156.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes the company handled mass layoffs better than Twitter after Elon Muk's takeover, a Business Insider report has said. At a company townhall meeting, Zuckerberg said Musk 'clearly didn't have the time to plan the layoffs as thoughtfully as a lot of other companies including Meta'. Twitter fired 3,700 employees while Meta cut over 11,000 jobs.

157.title: Fake currency note racket busted in Thane; ₹8 cr seized, 2 arrested
157.article_body: The Thane Police on Saturday busted a fake currency racket from Wagle Estate and arrested two persons in connection with the case. The police have recovered ₹8 crore worth fake currency from the arrested persons. They recovered 400 bundles of fake notes of ₹2000 from the possession of the accused.

158.title: Delhi's min temp reaches 12.6°C, air quality remains 'very poor'
158.article_body: Delhi's temperature started dipping and was recorded at 12.6 degrees Celsius early on Saturday, a day after the minimum temperature of 14.6 degrees Celsius was recorded. Saturday's temperature was a notch below the season's average. Meanwhile, air quality remained in the 'very poor' category with the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 311 at 9 am, CPCB data showed.

159.title: India to be among top 3 economic powers in 10-15 yrs: FM Sitharaman
159.article_body: India has emerged as one of the fastest-growing major economies in the world and is expected to be one of the top three economic powers globally in the next 10-15 years, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. She added that the Indian economy is not insulated from the impact of global economic developments as the global economic outlook remains challenging.

160.title: He set off my bullshit detector: Musk on FTX ex-CEO who offered him $3 bn to buy Twitter
160.article_body: Commenting on FTX ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, who once expressed his interest in investing in Elon Musk's bid for Twitter, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "He set off my bullshit detector." Musk's banker on the Twitter deal had informed him that Bankman-Fried was offering "at least $3 billion" to help him buy Twitter. FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday.

161.title: Woman injured in chain snatching incident in Hyderabad's Punjagutta
161.article_body: A woman sustained injuries on her neck when bike-borne men snatched a gold chain weighing three tolas from her in Hyderabad's Punjagutta on Thursday. The incident took place around 2:30 pm when the woman, Vastavayi Neeraja, was standing near her apartment building. Based on her complaint, the police have booked a case and an investigation is underway.

162.title: India's industrial output reports 3.1% growth in September
162.article_body: India's industrial output, measured through the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a 3.1% growth in September, data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation showed on Friday. Earlier in August, output had contracted by 0.8%. As per the data, the mining, manufacturing and electricity sectors grew at 4.6%, 1.8% and 11.6%, respectively.

163.title: Arjun, Bhumi & Rakul to star in comedy film 'Mere Husband Ki Biwi': Report
163.article_body: Actors Arjun Kapoor, Bhumi Pednekar and Rakul Preet Singh are set to star in a comedy movie titled 'Mere Husband Ki Biwi', according to a report. "It's a tale of a protagonist and the humour arises from the situation of [him]...being stuck in a love triangle," a source was quoted as saying. The film will reportedly be released in 2023.

164.title: Comeback in last 4 matches has given us confidence: Babar ahead of T20 WC final
164.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said their comeback in the last four matches has given them confidence ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "We're confident and we also have the belief to do well," he added. Pakistan won four consecutive games to reach the final after losing their opening two games in the tournament.

165.title: Class 12 B'luru boy plays 'Vande Mataram' on flute on Vande Bharat train
165.article_body: A video of a Bengaluru boy playing the 'Vande Mataram' tune on his flute while on board South India's first Vande Bharat Express train has emerged on social media. The video, posted by railway bureaucrat Ananth Rupanagudi, showed Class 12 student Aprameya Seshadri playing the flute as other passengers listened intently. A netizen commented, "I love this Vande Bharat initiative."

166.title: Congress releases Gujarat poll manifesto, promises 10 lakh govt jobs
166.article_body: The Congress on Saturday released its manifesto for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has promised to provide 10 lakh government jobs, ₹3,000 unemployment allowance, gas cylinders at ₹500 and 300 units of free electricity if it comes to power in the state. The party also tweeted that it will stop the "mindless" privatisation of education and healthcare sectors.

167.title: Stop Russia from playing hunger games: Ukrainian minister to ASEAN
167.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has urged ASEAN members to take every step to stop Russia from playing "hunger games" over Black Sea grain deal. The deal signed between Russia and Ukraine could end soon if either of the signatories objects to an extension. Kuleba said it is important to make sure that Russia doesn't cause "artificial delays" in shipment.

168.title: Man, his aide hacked to death by group of men in Pune; FIR filed
168.article_body: An FIR has been filed after a group of men allegedly hacked a man and his aide to death in Pune, officers said. The man, who was convicted of firing a gun at a hotelier in 2008, was released from jail after completing his punishment, police said. Prima facie, police suspect duo was murdered to avenge the attack, officers added.

169.title: Kerala RPF officer saves girl from getting crushed under train; video shared
169.article_body: An RPF officer saved a minor girl from falling and getting crushed under a moving train in Kerala. A video of the incident was shared by RPF India. The video shows the girl running to board the train but falling down as she attempts to get inside the door. The RPF officer is seen catching hold of her.

170.title: We're too critical of our players: Uthappa on KL Rahul's criticism over form
170.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa has said people are being too critical of players following India's semi-final exit from the 2022 T20 WC. On KL Rahul registering single-digit scores against Pakistan, SA and England, Uthappa said, "In all of India's T20I victories, Rahul's got the second or third highest number of fifties. You can't say he's not performing in big matches."

171.title: Bipasha Basu, Karan Singh Grover blessed with a baby girl
171.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu and actor Karan Singh Grover have been blessed with their first child. Basu delivered a baby girl on Saturday. The duo had announced in August that they are expecting their first child together. The couple, who had first met on the sets of 'Alone' which released in 2015, got married in April 2016.

172.title: Old sandals worn by Steve Jobs receive bids of over ₹17 lakh at auction
172.article_body: An old pair of Birkenstock sandals worn by Apple co-founder Steve Jobs in the 1970s and 80s are up for auction with bids of over $22,000 (around ₹17.7 lakh) received so far. The sandals, being sold by California-based Julien's Auction, are expected to fetch $60,000-$80,000 (around ₹48 lakh-₹64 lakh). They were previously owned by his house manager.

173.title: Hedge fund Galois Capital's assets worth $100 mn stuck on FTX: Report
173.article_body: Close to half the assets of hedge fund Galois Capital, estimated to be around $100 million, were trapped on collapsed crypto exchange FTX, the Financial Times reported. "I am deeply sorry that we find ourselves in this current situation," Galois Co-founder Kevin Zhou wrote to investors, adding that it could take "a few years" to recover "some percentage" of assets.

174.title: Gujarat ATS, Delhi Police arrest Afghan man with 8 kg heroin worth ₹56 crore
