349.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar on Friday said that diversity was India's strength and the aim of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' was to protect it. Addressing a press conference in Maharashtra's Nanded, Kumar said there's difference between a political yatra and an electoral one. "In the current political discourse, non-issues are being given priority, while important ones are sidelined," he added.

350.title: Don't agree with Sonia Gandhi: Congress on release of Rajiv Gandhi killing convicts
350.article_body: Congress 'disagrees' with Sonia Gandhi's views on the release of the convicts of her husband Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said. "Sonia Gandhi...is entitled to her personal views," he said, calling the release "entirely untenable, undefendable". Sonia Gandhi had pleaded for leniency for convict Nalini, leading to her sentence being reduced to life term.

351.title: Do authorities care: Biocon chief as kids get stuck in B'luru traffic
351.article_body: After children missed school due to traffic jam in Bengaluru, Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "Do the authorities even care? Citizens will have to keep shaming them into action." She stated that "ground-level officials" need to be held accountable. Meanwhile, ex-Infosys Director Mohandas Pai asked, "Is there hope at all in Bengaluru? What are police doing to clear traffic?"

352.title: Ola to shut down its infotainment service Ola Play from Nov 15
352.article_body: Ride-hailing startup Ola on Friday announced that it will shut its 'Ola Play' service in India effective from November 15. Launched in 2016, Ola Play is an in-cab infotainment service which provides customers access to music, videos and other such services. In a public notice, Ola said it has taken appropriate measures to remove the segment from the market.

353.title: Orchestra bar raided in Mumbai; 23 arrested, 13 women rescued
353.article_body: An orchestra bar, which was allegedly being operated illegally in Mumbai's Ghatkopar, was raided and 23 persons were arrested and 13 women rescued, police said on Friday. Women were allegedly found dancing in the establishment, police said, adding those arrested included the bar manager, cashier, seven waiters and 13 customers. Police seized ₹35,760 cash and computer equipment during the raid.

354.title: It is a very good film, I cried a lot: Shehnaaz Gill on 'Uunchai'
354.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill called Sooraj R Barjatya's 'Uunchai' a "very good film" and said that she "cried a lot" after watching it. "One message that I've got from this movie is that impossible things can be made possible," she added. Shehnaaz attended the special screening of the film on Wednesday, which was hosted by Anupam Kher's acting school, Actor Prepares.

355.title: 46-yr-old man kills brother over family dispute in Hyderabad
355.article_body: A 46-year-old man, Komera David, allegedly killed his 42-year-old brother, Komera Jonah, in Hyderabad's Jagathgiri Gutta over a family dispute. According to police, the two had been fighting over property and sharing their parents' responsibility for the last few years. On Wednesday, they had an argument, after which David allegedly grabbed a granite stone and hit Jonah on his head.

356.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
356.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Friday, with Bihar's Motihari and Siwan having the highest AQI at 413 and 406, respectively. This is followed by Bettiah (395), Darbhanga (388), Begusarai (381), Buxar (377), Jind (371), Purnia (358), Saharsa (358), Gurugram (353) and Delhi (346).

357.title: SoftBank Group reports $21-billion quarterly profit after Alibaba deal
357.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group on Friday reported a net profit of 3.033 trillion yen ($21.77 billion) for the July-September quarter, marking the first net profit in three quarters. This comes after it logged gains related to sales of its shares in Alibaba Group Holding. Meanwhile, SoftBank Vision Fund posted a 1.38 trillion yen ($9.8 billion) investment loss in the second quarter.

358.title: ED searches Binance wallet IDs, freezes ₹22.82-cr Bitcoins in E-nuggets case
358.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) searched wallet or user IDs associated with Binance cryptocurrency exchange in a probe related to the mobile gaming app E-nuggets on Friday. ED froze 150.22 Bitcoins worth ₹22.82 crore. In October, ED conducted raids on two premises in Kolkata. ED alleged Aamir Khan, businessman Nesar Ahmed Khan's son, launched E-nuggets that was designed to defraud the public.

359.title: Kherson's status as 'part of Russia' unchanged: Kremlin despite retreat
359.article_body: The Kremlin said that Russian forces' withdrawal from Kherson wouldn't change the status of the region. "It is legally fixed and defined," it added. Russia annexed Kherson and three other Ukrainian regions after holding what it called referendums in September. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Russia remained committed to achieving the goals of its "special military operation" in Ukraine.

360.title: 3 bar bouncers booked for assaulting 2 brothers in Gurugram
360.article_body: A case was registered on Wednesday against three bouncers for allegedly assaulting two brothers at a bar in Gurugram's Sector 42 on October 21. According to police, the assault took place when the men intervened in an altercation between their friends and the bouncers. The duo was found to have sustained multiple blunt force injuries, as per doctors, said police.

361.title: AAP releases manifesto for MCD polls, promises to make Delhi garbage-free
361.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal released AAP's manifesto for the upcoming MCD polls, scheduled to take place on December 4, and promised to make the city garbage-free. He also promised to make the MCD corruption-free and solve vehicle parking problems as part of the manifesto. He has also assured people that the MCD workers will get their salaries on time.

362.title: US to send $400 million more to Ukraine as military aid
362.article_body: The US will send $400 million more in military aid to Ukraine, US officials said on Thursday. According to the Pentagon, the aid package will include Stinger missiles, 10,000 mortar rounds, thousands of artillery rounds for howitzers and 400 grenade launchers. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US defence systems are "just what we needed and what we asked for".

363.title: 35-year-old auto driver dies by suicide after killing wife in Hyd
363.article_body: A 35-year-old autorickshaw driver allegedly killed his 33-year-old wife and then committed suicide on Thursday at their home in Hyderabad's Jagadgirigutta area. Police discovered the remains of Raju and Kavitha in different rooms of their home. As per the police, the couple frequently got into arguments. Raju hanged himself from a ceiling fan after confirming Kavitha's death, the police said.

364.title: Good day for democracy & America: Joe Biden on midterm election
364.article_body: After the initial outcome of the midterm election, US President Joe Biden said it was a good day for democracy and America. "Our democracy has been tested in recent years, but with their votes, the American people have spoken...once again that democracy is who we are," Biden said. Vote counting in states including Arizona and Nevada is underway.

365.title: UK economy contracts by 0.2% in third quarter: ONS
365.article_body: The UK economy contracted by 0.2% in the third quarter, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said. The Bank of England last week said the UK economy was set to contract in the final quarter, indicating the economy was in a recession, adding the economy could remain in recession until mid-2024. UK inflation is at a four-decade high above 10%.

366.title: Rahul Dravid given break for New Zealand tour, VVS Laxman to coach India
366.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has been given a break for the tour of New Zealand, with VVS Laxman taking over as acting head coach. As per a PTI report, Hrishikesh Kanitkar and Sairaj Bahutule will take up roles of batting and bowling coach, respectively, for the tour. The tour will commence with a three-match T20I series on November 18.

367.title: Police officer being investigated over Seoul's Halloween crush found dead
367.article_body: A South Korean police officer being investigated in connection with the Halloween crowd crush that killed over 150 people in Seoul was found dead in his home on Friday. Jeong was accused of ordering the destruction of an intelligence report warning of a serious accident over Halloween in Itaewon, after an investigation began into police responses to the crush.

368.title: 70-year-old UP farmer dies as bees attack him in agricultural field
368.article_body: A 70-year-old farmer died after a swarm of bees attacked him while he was working in an agricultural field in Uttar Pradesh. The incident came to light when the farmer did not return back home. His body was found covered in bees. While the villagers were able to disperse the bees using smoke, he had passed away by then.

369.title: Father-son duo arrested for cheating people of ₹20 crore in Hyderabad
369.article_body: The Hyderabad Central Crime Station (CCS) police arrested a man and his son for allegedly cheating people of ₹20 crore on the pretext of developing a property. "Nine cases have been registered against [them] this year. The accused were trying to escape from the country when our team arrested them at Ram Koti on Thursday," the ACP of CCS said.

370.title: Come to Kolkata: Derek to Vir after his B'luru show gets cancelled
370.article_body: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Friday invited stand-up comedian Vir Das to Kolkata after his show was cancelled in Bengaluru following protests by a right-wing group. "We would love to have you here this winter," he tweeted. Earlier, Das released a video saying, "Many assumptions are made about my content...I trust my art and my audience to speak for me."

371.title: Kartik Aaryan joins Suniel Shetty, Paresh Rawal in 'Hera Pheri 3'
371.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has joined the cast of 'Hera Pheri 3', Paresh Rawal has confirmed. According to a report, Kartik will play Raju, a role which was previously played by Akshay Kumar. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, Akshay has opted out of the film as he "couldn't align with the...script idea". The film will reportedly also feature Suniel Shetty.

372.title: Iran agrees to set up a meeting with IAEA to discuss uranium traces
372.article_body: Iran has agreed to a visit by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on the issue of the origin of uranium particles found at three sites, Reuters reported citing a confidential IAEA document. The IAEA "expects to start receiving...technically credible explanations...including access to locations and material, as well as the taking of samples as appropriate", the document added.

373.title: India, US are natural allies, says US Treasury Secy Yellen
373.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen during her visit to New Delhi on Friday said US and India are "natural allies". "We may be located across the world from each other, but what unites us is far greater than any of our differences," Yellen added. "India's G20 year is a chance to accelerate global coordination on debt restructuring," she further said.

374.title: Kangana Ranaut calls Instagram 'dumb', says 'It is all about pictures'
374.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Friday and called the social media platform "dumb". She said it "is all about pictures". "Whatever opinion one writes disappears...next day as if everyone is a...frivolous dumbo...who doesn't want to see what he/she wrote a day before because they anyway don't mean what they say, so it [should] rather disappear," Kangana added.

375.title: Man participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra gets hit by truck in Maha, dies
375.article_body: A 62-year-old man from Tamil Nadu, Ganesan Ponraman, died and another person from that state was injured after being hit by a truck in Maharashtra's Nanded district when they were participating in Congress's ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, a police official said on Friday. Expressing grief, former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi said, "We have lost a true soldier of the party."

376.title: 'Whisper list' contains 40 UK politicians never to accept a drink from: Female MP
376.article_body: An MP has claimed there is a "whisper list" of roughly 40 UK politicians to keep at arm's length. Charlotte Nichols, the MP for Warrington North, said she was warned of colleagues to never accept a drink from or be alone with. The list, which is not written down, includes people known for "bullying or sexual misconduct".

377.title: Mahindra to sell 80% controlling stake in Peugeot Motocycles
377.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra announced that it is selling 80% controlling stake in its French unit Peugeot Motocycles to Germany-based Mutares. "Mutares has submitted an irrevocable binding offer to acquire 50% of equity and a controlling stake of 80% in Peugeot Motocycles," it said. Mahindra will remain a co-shareholder to support new product launches and the growth expected in coming years.

378.title: Screen 3,000 Govandi houses daily: Health dept to BMC amid measles outbreak
378.article_body: After Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) confirmed measles outbreak in Govandi's Rafi Nagar, state health department officials visited the area on Thursday. They directed BMC officials to conduct door-to-door screening of 3,000 houses daily, for the next 10 days. "A special camp will be conducted to immunise kids who have missed their vaccination(s)," joint director (health services) said.

379.title: Shefali's son compares her to Robert as Iron Man; says no one can replace you
379.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said her son said that she became like Iron Man in 'Delhi Crime 2'. "He said, 'Every Marvel superhero has been portrayed by various actors, except Iron Man...It's only Robert Downey Jr. Nobody can replace him and it's the same about you'," she added. She said she thought he meant it as her being a superwoman.

380.title: Hong Kong jails woman journalist for insulting China's national anthem
380.article_body: A woman journalist who waved a British colonial-era flag to celebrate Hong Kong claiming Olympic gold in 2021 has become the first person in the city to be jailed on a charge of insulting Chinese national anthem. Paula Leung allegedly waved the flag at a shopping mall when Chinese national anthem was playing during the streaming of the award ceremony.

381.title: Man stabbed, robbed by auto driver and his aide in Gurugram
381.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed and robbed by an autorickshaw driver and his accomplice on National Highway 48 near Gurugram's Iffco Chowk on Thursday afternoon, police said. According to the victim, the driver's aide was masquerading as another passenger. The victim was allegedly robbed of ₹300 and his phone. He was purportedly stabbed in his chest and right hand.

382.title: PM flags 1st 8-day religious tour from K'taka-Kashi, train package costs ₹20,000
382.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday flagged off the first eight-day religious tour of the Bharat Gaurav train from Bengaluru to Varanasi. The train will go through Hubballi, Belagavi in Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj and Ayodhya. The all-inclusive package costs ₹20,000 and the state government will give ₹5,000 as a subsidy. The first journey will carry around 600 pilgrims.

383.title: 'Modi no entry' banners appear in Hyd ahead of PM's Telangana visit
383.article_body: 'Modi no entry to Telangana' flex banners have appeared in Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills and HITEC City areas of Hyderabad ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the state. The banners, purportedly installed by Telangana Chenetha Youth Force, asked the PM to roll back 5% GST on handloom products. PM Modi is slated to visit the state on Saturday.

384.title: 'Shivling' found in Gyanvapi to be protected till further orders: Supreme Court
384.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday extended its earlier order for the protection of the 'Shivling' discovered at the Gyanvapi mosque complex in UP's Varanasi. This means the May 17 order of the apex court has been extended. The ruling came on an appeal by the Hindu side to extend the order, which was to expire tomorrow (November 12).

385.title: Jacqueline's interim bail in ₹200 crore money laundering case extended till Nov 15
385.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez's interim bail in a ₹200 crore money laundering case has been extended till November 15. The order on regular bail will be pronounced on that day. While hearing her bail plea, the court on Thursday warned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) not to implement a "pick-and-choose policy" and questioned why it hasn't arrested her yet.

386.title: ASI found dead with gunshot injury inside police station in Punjab
386.article_body: The police have launched an investigation after a 50-year-old Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was found dead inside a police station in Punjab's Ludhiana with a gunshot injury. The deceased's colleagues claimed that he was in depression since his wife died. "It is yet to be ascertained if it was a suicide or accidental injury," the Station House Officer (SHO) said.

387.title: Who are the 6 convicts granted premature bail in Rajiv Gandhi assassination case?
387.article_body: India's longest-serving woman convict Nalini Sriharan and her husband Murugan alias Sriharan (alleged mastermind) are among six people granted premature bail in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. Sri Lankans Santhan (an LTTE Intelligence Wing member) and Robert Payas (a suspected LTTE member) were also among them. RP Ravichandran and Jayakumar (Payas' brother-in-law) were also released.

388.title: Twitter handle named 'Jesus Christ' gets blue tick after $8 plan; people react
388.article_body: A Twitter handle named 'Jesus Christ' has received the blue verification tick after CEO Elon Musk's $8/month for blue tick plan rolled out. Reacting to the account, a Twitter user said, "I'm still waiting for Santa to come on Twitter.....I just KNOW he's real!" "I see no confusion here. The Lord has returneth. Praise be to Saint Musk," said another.

389.title: 9 players shortlisted for Player of the T20 World Cup 2022 award, list released
389.article_body: The 9-member shortlist for the Player of the T20 World Cup 2022 award has been revealed by the ICC. Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav are the two Indians who have made the cut. The other seven players include Pakistan's Shadab Khan and Shaheen Afridi, England's Sam Curran, Jos Buttler and Alex Hales, Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza and Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga.

390.title: Foxconn to quadruple workforce at Tamil Nadu iPhone plant: Report
390.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn plans to quadruple the workforce to 70,000 at its iPhone factory in Tamil Nadu over two years, Reuters reported citing two government officials. This development comes even as Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant, the world's largest iPhone factory, is facing disruptions in production over China's COVID-19 policy impacting global supply chains. Foxconn opened the India plant in 2019.

391.title: Liquor ban unsuccessful in Bihar, needs public support: Upendra Kushwaha
391.article_body: According to JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha, the liquor ban in Bihar has been unsuccessful till now. He urged citizens of the state to come forward to make it successful. "It's a chain between the suppliers and the consumers…if the sale is stopped in Bihar, its consumption will also stop…it cannot be implemented successfully without [public support]," said Kushwaha.

392.title: CO2 emissions from fossil fuels to hit all time high this year: Scientists at COP27
392.article_body: While speaking at the ongoing COP27 climate summit, scientists from the Global Carbon Project warned that harmful carbon dioxide emissions from fossil fuels would rise 1% more this year, reaching an all-time high. Scientists added that emissions declined to -5.2% in 2020 due to restrictions imposed during the COVID pandemic. However, emissions increased by 5.6% in 2021.

393.title: Unacceptable: Jairam as SC orders release of Rajiv Gandhi case convicts
393.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Friday called the decision "totally unacceptable" as the Supreme Court ordered the release of six convicts serving life terms in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. "The Congress Party criticises it clearly...It is most unfortunate that the Supreme Court has not acted in consonance with the spirit of India on this issue," he added.

394.title: Sensex jumps 1,200 points, Nifty ends above 18,300 after hitting 52-week highs
394.article_body: The Sensex jumped nearly 1,200 points to close at 61,795 on Friday, while the Nifty gained more than 320 points to end at nearly 18,350. The benchmark indices hit 52-week highs during the intraday trade, aided by gains across IT, metals, realty and banking stocks. Meanwhile, the Indian rupee was trading higher by 86 paise at 80.95 per US dollar.

395.title: Why were govt funds used for Kempegowda's statue in Bengaluru: Shivakumar
395.article_body: Congress leader DK Shivakumar asked why government funds were used to install Bengaluru founder Nadaprabhu Kempegowda's statue in the city's international airport. "Using government funds [for installing statue] is a big crime...The Bengaluru International Airport Limited...should have used its money...Is it not earning?" Shivakumar asked. Notably, PM Narendra Modi unveiled the statue on Friday.

396.title: Man from Bihar molests 10-year-old girl inside Delhi mosque; arrested
396.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested a man for allegedly molesting a 10-year-old girl inside a mosque in the Maujpur area of the national capital. The 24-year-old accused has been identified as Mohammad Imran, who hails from Bihar's Kishanganj. "An FIR under sections 354…and 341…of the Indian Penal Code and [section] 10 [of] POCSO Act was registered," said a police officer.

397.title: Zoho using Sanskrit to build machine translation software: CEO
397.article_body: Indigenous software-as-a-service company Zoho is working on developing a machine translation software using Sanskrit as an intermediary layer. "When you translate between any two languages, you have to first go to a common format...Whole point here is to be the most precise...feature of the Sanskrit language that it is very precise and accurate," Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu said.

398.title: I don't agree that India made above-par total & lost because of bowling: Sehwag
398.article_body: Virender Sehwag said India lost their semi-final against England in the first 10 overs of the game. "If India feel they made an above-par total and it's bowling's fault, I don't agree," he added. "If the top order [scores 77 in 12 overs]...expecting the rest of the batters to...score 100 runs in eight overs, that's not right," Sehwag further said.

399.title: Hyderabad Police conduct rowdy sheeters mela, 47 rowdy sheets closed
399.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday conducted a rowdy sheeters mela at CAR headquarters, where 47 rowdy sheets in south zone were closed by Police Commissioner CV Anand. According to a police statement, 35 rowdy sheets were closed because they maintained a clean record for the last 10 years. The others were closed based on their health records, the statement added.

400.title: Actress Parvati Nair often slapped me, spit on me: Domestic help accused of theft
400.article_body: Actress Parvati Nair's domestic help, whom she accused of theft, has alleged that she used to often slap him and spit on him. He claimed that the actress framed him for theft because he had seen unknown people visiting her house at night. Two watches worth ₹9 lakh, iPhone and laptop were allegedly stolen from her Chennai home in October.
